com.amazonaws.mobileconnectors.pinpoint.analytics

Class SessionClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amazonaws.mobileconnectors.pinpoint.analytics.SessionClient

  • public class SessionClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Client for managing starting and stopping sessions which records session events automatically as the session is stopped or started. It is recommended to start the session when the application comes to the foreground and stop the session when it goes to the background.

    • Nested Class Summary

      protected static class  SessionClient.SessionState
      Internal Representation of Application Session's state

      • pinpointContext

        protected final PinpointContext pinpointContext
        The context object wraps all the essential information from the app that are required.

      • session

        protected Session session
        This session object tracks whether or not it has been paused by checking the status of it's stop time. A session's stop time is only set when the session has been paused, and is set to -1 if it is currently running. Can be serialized and restored for persistence. This refers to the current session object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SessionClient

        public SessionClient(PinpointContext pinpointContext)
        CONSTRUCTOR
        Parameters:
        pinpointContext - The PinpointContext

    • Method Detail

      • startSession

        public void startSession()
        Start a session which records a SESSION_START_EVENT_TYPE event and saves that sessionId to the AnalyticsClient to be used for recording future events. This triggers an update of the endpointProfile. It is recommended to start the session when the application comes to the foreground.

      • stopSession

        public void stopSession()
        Stops a session which records a SESSION_STOP_EVENT_TYPE event and flushes the events in localstorage for submission. It is recommended to stop the session when the application goes to the background.

      • pauseSession

        public void pauseSession()
        Briefly pauses an application session. This records a SESSION_PAUSE_EVENT_TYPE event. It is recommended to call in an activity's onPause() method.

      • resumeSession

        public void resumeSession()
        Resumes an application session. This records a SESSION_RESUME_EVENT_TYPE event. It is recommended to call in an activity's onResume() method.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overridden toString method for testing
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        diagnostic string

      • executeStart

        protected void executeStart()
        Start a new Session. Set the Session ID and start time and record an event of type SESSION_START_EVENT_TYPE.

      • executeStop

        protected void executeStop()
        Stop the current Session. First, pause the session if it's not paused already. Record the stop time and record an event of type SESSION_STOP_EVENT_TYPE. Additionally, stopping a session clears the campaign attributes.

      • executePause

        protected void executePause()
        Pause the current session object - Fire a Session Pause Event - Persist Session to the file system. (prepares for quiet death). Record an event of type SESSION_PAUSE_EVENT_TYPE

      • executeResume

        protected void executeResume()
        Re-Activate the session - Fire Session Resume Event/ Record an event of type SESSION_RESUME_EVENT_TYPE

      • getSession

        protected Session getSession()
        Getters
        Returns:
        the current session object

      • getSessionState

        protected SessionClient.SessionState getSessionState()
        Returns:
        the current Session's state
